page.title: 01Dalham and Denham Suffolk
page.content: In general an arable farming area (mainly cereals and sugarbeet) on clay loam soils overlying chalk. Altitude 55-105m. Dalham in SW lies in valley of 2-3m wide stream which often dries in summer. A picturesque village with many 'second homes' some brought for retirement. Many of residents are retired or work in local towns such as Bury St Edmunds or Newmarket. Amenties include an Anglican church, post office and general stores and a public house serving meals. One km to the north is Dalham Hall in wooded parkland. Denham to the SE is smaller; a few houses, farms and a church. The nearest shops etc are in Barrow 2 km to the NE.
